Instruction: Add garlic, lemon juice, tahini, cumin, and salt to the chickpeas; process until smooth and well combined.
Add salt, cumin, and coriander to the bowl; mix until thoroughly combined.
In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, cumin, coriander, salt, baking powder, lemon juice, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Stir the egg mixture and 1 tablespoon of olive oil into the chickpea mixture until thoroughly combined.
Slowly incorporate bread crumbs into the chickpea mixture until it binds together without becoming sticky. Adjust the amount of bread crumbs as necessary.
Shape the mixture into balls and flatten them into small patties.
Heat olive oil in a large cast iron skillet until it's 1 inch deep, and set it over medium-high heat.
Fry the patties in hot oil until they are browned, about 3 to 5 minutes on each side.

The nutritional value of the oil used for frying has been calculated based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. Actual amounts may differ depending on factors such as cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil employed.
